body.name: SmallRig AD-80 FreeBlazer Heavy-Duty Tripod System, 75" Video Tripod with Fluid Head, One-Step Height Adjust, Dual-Mode QR Plate, Load up to 17lbs, Professional Tripod for Camera - 4163
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 7 hrs 8 mins
features: One-Step Height Adjustment: This heavy duty tripod AD-80 is a video tripod kit to facilitate video shooting with adjustable legs, quickly retracted and extended via one step locks, no need to unlock 6 step like common tripods, and a height ranging from 34"-75"(87 cm- 191cm) and a folded length of 35"(90.5cm).

Stable Support with Maxium Loading: Professional video tripod designed with high-strength aluminum alloy and double-row tubes to provide better stability for the video tripod. The tripod weight 9.6lbs(4.3kg) with maximum load to 17.6lbs(8kg). The camera tripod is compatible with SmallRig Universal Photography Tripod Dolly (ID:3986)

Fluid Head with Damping: The heavy duty video head featuring a damping system, allows you to 360° pan smoothly and +90°/-65° tilt the camera. When its center of gravity height is put at 55mm, the panning, and pre-set counterbalance system can help precisely control the camera for great dynamic balance. Built-in spirit level to help camera find horizontal position.

Dual-Mode Quick-Release Plate: The fluid head has a newly-designed snap-on quick-release plate mount, a more efficient mounting solution than traditional slide-on ones, which is for DJI RS 2 / RS 3 / RS 3 Pro quick release plate and for Manfrotto quick release plate compatible to realize a free switch between stabilizer shooting and tripod shooting.

Detachable Handle for Easily Store: There is a detachable pan handle for easy storage and operation, and it suits both left-handed and right-handed users. The video head also comes with one 1/4"-20 threaded hole to support the magic arm and other accessories, and a customized carrying bag for better storage, protection, and carrying around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great tripod at a great price
reviews.reviewText: This SmallRig tripod is great ! I do multiple camera video shoots and recently purchased an additional camera that I needed a tripod for. Did a lot of searching of many manufacturers and decided on the Small rig. It's well built and very light weight and sturdy. Leg extension is smooth and easy to extend and retract. The lever action latches on the legs are easy to operate and provide a positive grip. The storage zipper case also well made with room for the pan head . I own two other brand tripods I have had for a few years now Seeing how nice this one is I'm considering selling them and replacing with 2 more of these these Small Rig tripods. If you are in the market for a great tripod, I would recommend this SmallRig AD-80 FreeBlaze tripod.Very impressive....

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great value and arrived on time. Quality material and will definitely be a welcomed addition.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’ve only purchased Manfrotto tripods for the past 30 years. I took a chance on this tripod and it quickly became my favorite. I reach for this tripod over Manfrotto every time. Love the release levers and the video head is incredibly smooth. Excellent value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Used to hold star gazing binoculars.
reviews.reviewText: As a member of an astronomy club that does public sky parties, my offering is binoculars on a parallelogram so visitors of different heights can easily step up and see the subject of interest by moving the binoculars up or down to their eye level. Ideally it would be nice to have a view free of any shaking but such a setup would not likely be portable. This tripod, despite being made in China, is well built with high friction adjustments allowing for much flexibility in setting it up. When I upgraded my binoculars, I needed a tripod that could handle the extra weight along with 14 pounds of counter weights. This would never have worked with my older "heavy duty" camera tripod.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Product is Good, but don't trust the shipping time
reviews.reviewText: The tripod is great and was a big value for the price at $159. However, I had a bad experience with the shipping. I ordered it on a Thursday because it stated I would receive it by Saturday (in time for a photoshoot on Monday). On Saturday when it did not arrive I checked the status and it now said it would not arrive until the following Saturday. I checked the product listing to make sure I didnt misread it when I placed my order and noticed 2 alarming things:1. The price was not $2502. If I ordered it again it would deliver by Tuesday.So in summary: I ordered on Thursday for $150 and it would take 9 days to deliver, but if I was willing to order it again for $250 it would deliver in 3 days.It smells to me like someone made a mistake in the pricing and changed my delivery time in the hopes I would cancel my order because based on the quality of the tripod I can tell you that it is worth the $250.In conclusion, the tripod is a steal at $150 and a good deal at $250. But keep a close eye on the shipping time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy but super sturdy
reviews.reviewText: Much heavier than expected, not a piece of gear I would carry around outdoors, but perfect for studio video and still photography. Super stable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Literally the best tri-pod I have ever owned. I’m just 3 clicks I can level it at any height. That’s efficient! Not to mention, heavy duty! I modified my fluid head with Neweer as they have a better fluid system in my opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Like everything about it Dislike, not that it's not worth it but, the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best tripod I have ever used!
reviews.reviewText: I don’t think I’ll ever need a tripod again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointing Quality and Lack of Customer Support
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I purchased this tripod with high hopes, given its seemingly affordable price. However, my experience with it has been nothing short of disappointing. The materials used in its construction are of cheap quality, and it became evident from day one.Unlike my previous tripod (a Manfrotto), which served me well for nearly a decade without any issues, this one began falling apart almost immediately. The build quality is subpar, and after just a month of use, the tripod is now completely non-functional, as clearly demonstrated in the attached video.What frustrates me even more is the complete absence of customer service. When I tried to reach out for assistance, I encountered roadblocks and found no resolution to the issues I faced with the product.In conclusion, I would strongly advise against purchasing this tripod. It may seem like a budget-friendly option, but the long-term durability and customer service are sorely lacking.
